page.title: 16History of Nevill Holt
page.content: Holt was created from cleared woodland in the 12 or 13 Centuries. Sir Thomas Nevill purchased the property and extensions to the Great Hall were built in the 14th. Century. The Great Hall remains the least altered since its construction. The Nevill Family, after 400 years of occupancy, sold Nevill Holt in 1868 to help pay their debts. Edward Cunard bought the property for Â£105,000.Through the Cunard's interest in the Fernie Hunt Medbourne prospered greatly. In 1920 it ceased being a private residence and was opened as a Preparatory School which it has remained ever since. Mr.F.Seville Phillips became headmaster in 1928 to be succeeded by his son, Mr.David Phillips, who is the present owner and headmaster of Nevill Holt. It is both a boarding and day school for boys and girls.
